intro: Hieracium subcaesium subsp. subcaesitium, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of stiff, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the genus Hieracium. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic characteristics compared to other members of the species.
